reviewText: When I first started reading On Air I was a bit confused. I had no idea what I was reading, but I should have known that Hadley Quinn wouldnt steer me wrong. Another great book from Hadley! Loved the twists and turns to this one, and that it kept me guessing up until the end. I was totally surprised with the way it ended but I loved how everything turned out.

What a pleasant surprise this read was! It had me guessing to the very end who the hero's hea would be with. Its written in the all male pov of single architect, Dane Thomas. Dane is a wonderful main character who is realistically written along with a great group of friends.

Dane is taken by a sultry radio voice of the star of Slice of the City with Sinclair. Sinclair promotes Dane's sisters coffee shop and saves her from having to close her doors.

From the loss of his parents and the burden of a secret about their marriage he has kept himself pretty closed off when it comes to relationships. In fact, he has been sleeping with Natalie Denman in a sex buddy situation for five years!

While thanking Sinclair in an email meeting this mysterious woman eventually does become a possibility. He also meets two other woman during the story and even gives this thing between him and Natalie a shot.

The story was very well written and paced with many layers to the plot and executed perfectly!

"Appreciate, don't expect."

reviewText: I discovered Hadley on a whim. I have never looked. Back. Her books are amazing on every level. From mysterious, to love, to sexy. I loved this book because it was one where I would figure out what was going to happen next. It kept my mind going. It made me laugh, and if had that emotion that I love so much. It was not a disappointment. Totally unexpected. It great  nonetheless.

All your favorite characters are back for round two in the second book in this dark comedy series. The bureaucrats are still trying to get Nathan to sign the relevant forms. The trials of being a ghost might be a metaphor for not being seen or noticed in life. The powers to be can't understand how they keep getting out foxed by Nathan. More sly humor chock full of interesting characters and situations with a side dish of revenge. Round two just as good and fun as round one. Loved it More Please!

Angelica and Nicole, best friends for twenty years, get together and do what girl-friends do, shop, go to the spa, discuss men, plot job moves, get teary eyed, and eat ice cream in the middle of the night. This is a continuing story of Angelica who has a job as city manager in Smoothville, Georgia, USA. This part of her life story is best understood after reading the novella, Blue Lady, which is available, free, for your Kindle. Angelica has been called away from her job to care for her father, who is recovering from a heart attack.
The reader should understand she consults and listens to her alter-ego, Blue Lady, in her thoughts. Also, Angelica experiences dreams, thus the book's title. As the reader, sometimes I am reading along through a crazy scene. I don't get it, until I learn Angelica has been dreaming, when I am told that she has awakened. The author, Stephany Tullis, has undertaken an interesting, but difficult, writing style, deeply developing a character by letting us move from dreams to reality and from thoughts to actions. This is part of the mystery. So, be prepared. It will make sense eventually, when Angelica wakes up to reality.

Really enjoyed this latest offering from Tullis who always manages to pull at my emotional heartstrings. Sweet Dreams focuses on familial obligations and the bond between a dad and his daughter making it a quick, satisfying read. Highly recommend for Hallmark Channel fans... this one is worth your time.
summary: Would Love to See a Hallmark Channel Adaptation

reviewText: Great story that explores the boundaries between fantasy and reality. Angelica is forced to move back home to look after her sick father, overseen by her demanding mother. Work and relationship problems ensue, as she enters a world where she finds it hard to pin-point what is true and what is fantasized. A superbly-written story full of realistic introspection, intriguing romance, and a honest appraisal of relationships, whether dependent upon blood or passion. Highly recommended.

I'm a fan of author Stephany Tullis, and can easily say Blue Lady's Sweet Dreams is now my favorite.  Her novels are all well written, but this one just seemed to flow so nicely, and I loved, loved the quotes (some well known and others not so much) she used as chapter headings. Langston Hughes was one of my childhood favorites, so seeing his quote solidified my reading connection with Tullis.

Not to worry if you did not read the first book (but you should as it will make you smile throughout), because a brief intro catches up readers to a point this second makes sense and flows smoothly.

As a current caretaker of my handicap granddaughter, I quickly attached to Angelica, knowing the emotional and physical toll this takes on us, but seeing it as a heavy load we simply carry.  Not everyone can handle it.  Parents, Marshall and Marilyn were complete opposites in outlook almost balanced Angelica's plight.  Thank goodness her father, Marshall was a shiny beacon in this familial storm.

Sweet Dreams has its fair share of twists and turns, introducing various characters that are well depicted by author Tullis.
Overall all, the deeply felt, thoughtfully drawn characters walked me though this philosophical story of enduring familial love with a smile on my face.  Yes, it is emotional, and yes we witness the hardships that often accompany bonds of family, but it teaches this may be a sacrifice, however in the end - is it really? I truly adored Stephany Tullis' unique writing of a situation many face in today's world.
summary: My favorite book by author Tullis, that elicited all kinds of emotions within.  Enjoy!

reviewText:
Another lovely story by this great writer. Angelica Mason is a dreamer. That's thanks in part, at least, to her charming alter ego, Blue Lady, who urges her on. In this story, her dreamy vision of life is put to the test. Dad's sick and Mom's not easy to please. Her boss is a jerk, and a boyfriend may not be the man she thought he was...
Sometimes it does seem it all falls apart at once, doesn't it?  But, as Marilyn Monroe once said, Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together. Can Angelica Mason hang on long enough to ride out the storms in her life? You'll just have to read this quick trip on the road with Angelica Mason to find out.
summary: A dreamer's vision put to the test in this charming story

reviewText:
Taken by her Mates- Oh my goodness! Prince Nial! My favorite Prillon Warrior by far!
Jessica is an Iraqi war vet and now a freelance photographer, only she's been framed and jailed on charges of selling drugs because she knew too much. Where better to get away from the people who assuredly want you dead than the Interstellar Bride program? Only once she matched to her perfect mate her transfer is denied, by the Prime himself. Jessica is heartbroken, no one wants her, not even the Aliens. But since her volunteering for the program and subsequent refusal commutes her sentence she's now a free agent. One that everyone thinks is off planet and she decides to use that loophole to find out and report the people who framed her.
What she doesn't expect is for her mate, and the Hive, to come looking for her. Or to fall in love with him.
Prince Nial has been contaminated by Hive technology and, in his father's opinion, undeserving of a bride because of it. Since his father is the Prime, ruler of the entire Prime world, he has the power to prevent the mating. Nial is done with his father's controlling ways though and will find his bride at any cost. (Does he have a cousin? I think he might be my match!)
I'm a sucker for the Prillon Warriors and I love the story of Nial coming after Jessica with the odds stacked against him. I loved that, for her, it wasn't love at first sight, though she did understand he was there to help her, once he'd introduced himself. And I love that her veteran status is able to give him and the other contaminated warriors a new lease on life.
summary: An alien rescue mission like you've never read before!

reviewText:
Taken Back (Taken, #1)
by Cali MacKay (Goodreads Author), Julie Farrell (Goodreads Author)

Wendy Hodges's review
Sep 17, 2017  edit

it was amazing

Intense, emotional and a very hot read. Nathan's father is homophobic, he hated that his son had shown interest in Jackson years before at college, so set Jackson up. Having lost what little he had at the time including his best friend and only love, Jackson has spent years since hating Nathan and his father. Now the business he has struggled to build is under threat, again it is the Steele family trying to take it from him. These two guys were falling in love before, now Nathan wants nothing more than to put things right but his father is still the same.
There is a murder amongst the turmoil and other events that happen in this story, there is a lot of sex as the guys despite everything are still attracted to each other and start to build some trust and develop their love. This is an M/M story so be aware if you don't like that subject matter, it is full on. I personally found it interesting both in how they work as a couple and the over all story, in fact I got quite warm at times. The plot as a whole contained some intrigue and mystery, it was fast paced with several things going on to keep you hooked. I found both main characters to be likeable, hot and very alpha. I loved that they were both trying to help each other, to understand and work at the relationship this time, that Nathan stood his ground. This is the first time I have read anything by Julie Farrell but I love Cali Mackay's books and have read almost all of them, this collaboration between the two really works well and I look forward to reading the next book.
summary: 2017  edit it was amazing Intense, emotional and a very hot read

reviewText: A second chance romance with a twist. Mystery, intrigue, and lots of steamy sex. Cant wait to read more.

I liked both of the MCs, though it took me a while to like Carter, Jax's friend, because his jealousy when Nathan first came around was petty and grated on my nerves. One thing that really bugged me, though, was Jax's attitude towards Nathan coming back into his life. I do understand his anger about the past and holding a grudge for years (trust me) but it was annoying how one minute he'd be willing to try to get past it but as soon as anything came up he was right back to being angry and mistrusting. He was flip-flopping back & forth so much that I was considering taking back liking him as a character. He was like a tantrum throwing toddler at times, it became a bit much. I also thought that for him hating Nathan so much, he sure did have a lot of sex with him, and that was before things changed between them. And the part in the synopsis about Jax being the only one Nathan could turn to was kind of untrue, because while they were actually both helping and protecting each other, it was mostly Nathan protecting Jax.

Overall, I liked the story. I liked that both of the men remained "manly" and didn't suddenly switch to overly flowery, feminine behavior and speech as can sometimes happen. The writing was pretty good and there were no editing mistakes at all that I could see. I especially liked that I wasn't able to immediately figure out the mystery or who the bad guy was. Definitely worth the time and the read.

reviewText: Oh my goodness how my heart hurt for Hell in this book! Part Four of Project Hellwow! This episode has so much going on- there was laughter and good times; there were some scary tense moments, moments of frustration and anger, and as always with Peyton some smoking hot I need a fan up in here moments. Were finding out some things about Sarah that are kind of surprising-theres a lot more to her than even Peyton could have imagined, and its not all pretty. And were getting a deeper look into Hells mind. She really has captured my heart as this series has progressed. Shes been put through so much, there's a lot she's holding onto- things she's seen and starting to remember, its so tough on her keeping these secrets. Shes a bit broken from everything and its starting to wear her down. I really enjoyed the deeper connections this book introduced, especially between Helen and Aunt Jo and Lee. The scenes with Lee were so tender and he was so wonderful with her, I loved the closeness they are starting to develop. And Hell and Peyton, oh my goodness! These 2, I have so much love for them! Peyton really opened himself up to Hell, laid himself bare. Gah I love that man! This has been such a terrific series. Felicity has such a way with words- Ive felt like Ive been living this story right along with the characters. The build-up to this point has been fantastic, and its leading to what I can only imagine will be an incredible conclusion, if the cliffhanger ending to this part is any indication!
summary: I need the conclusion in my hands right now!

Well, this is one pretty ambitious effort to take on, and a bravissimo to Liz D. Marx who does is with aplomb. It is not easy to interweave a criminal investigation, a history lesson, paranormal events, a mystery fantasy, an adventure, and a hot romance in a single storyline, and hope that everything turns right in the end! Most authors try incorporating one or two as the main idea, and enrich the writing with likeable characters. Or, it is just me trying to find more sense if I can identify a book by genre.

But even if The Ravens Trail (book one) has bits of all of the above colorations I will still put it into love story category. The contact of Chloe and Mason carries the action, and I must admit that Liz has a talent for turning paragraphs from slowly burning to sizzling. Even if they were something Ive seen so far, she definitely knows how to use a hot erotic line.

Chloe is instantly likeable, carrying some anti-hero traits like being a nerdy, stubborn loner with a personal history of mental illness. That serves the books idea nicely. Native American history, legends, and heritage in just the right amount make the events relatable and imaginative, and the final result intriguing.

Whats to come next?
summary: A successful genre mix wrapped up in a deep romance

reviewText:
The Ravens Trail is much more than a novel retreat.  Liz D. Marx crafted this beautiful story of the Tula Indian tribe that became the Warriors of the Rainbow.  They were very powerful, but a small tribe.  Prince Kaye of that tribe felt he needed to protect his clan by selling the land and moving before the white men destroyed their village.  His friend, Adsila, was struggling with her own destiny.  As the daughter of the spiritual leader, she was prevented from being the next Chenesi, as that is only passed down through the males.
Two hundred years later, Chloe finds a unique Indian stone in the Smithsonian as she is cataloguing artifacts.  It is connected to her through her dreams as a young girl.  To find out more she takes a vacation to the area the Tula tribe is rumored to have lived.  At the same time Mason Green is hunting down the same artifact Chloe has in her possession.
summary: Intense hunt for Indian artifact, love, & retribution.  Excellent read!

reviewText:
This story weaves elements of reincarnation with immortality, and Native American culture, and although much of it is created for the use of the book, the author makes it work. The subject of Native American culture is treated in a very sensitive manner, in my opinion, and the language is written in such as way as it is very casual, engaging, and believable.

I loved the heroine in this story. I could find myself relating to her and routing for her as she started going through her adventure with the hero. Although you might easily say that the hero in this story is not a traditional hero, and he is troubled and burdened in several senses, but that is a part of what makes this story so wonderful, and what drew me in.

I rarely get a book that I want to read in one setting because it is so well crafted, but this book had captured my attention from the first page, and I found myself not wanting to put it down for the rest of the day. It had me on the edge of my seat, wanting to find out what happened next during the entire book. There were sufficient surprises and enough twists and turns to keep me hooked. I am looking forward to catching the sequel to this novel.

Australian author Liz D. Marx received her degree in Performing Arts and her first foray in writing was creating children's plays, adapting Shakespeare for modern audiences, and translating the works of other international authors. Now she has settled in writing her own novels  first using the pen name Ella J Phoenix  to pen novels in her favored paranormal genre. She published five books in the Dragon Heat Series  stating on her website `Balancing life between working at a demanding full time job, living with a loving husband and feeding my obsession for paranormal novels is not easy.' Now using a new nom de plume - Liz D. Marx - she turns to romance novels passionate tales of love, filled with tense action, a touch of mystery and lots of magic, of course. She lives and creates in Sydney, Australia.

Like many authors of the paranormal type Ella created many very strange names that match the creatures she created. As Liz she does the same, but unlike most authors, Liz generously offers a glossary before the novel begins to give definitions of the ideas, the mythology, and names of certain characters and groups and in doing so she lets her reader know that she is escorting them into a new sphere.

Liz maintains her gift for building tension and romance simultaneously and places her story in a tribal situation not too distant from her practiced paranormal stories. At first the names require adjustment, but once the glossary is referenced for the first chapter the names fell and seem incidental, the story itself rises out of the strange setting into the realm of simply fine romance - and the setting becomes present day Washington, DC.

Liz offers a synopsis to assist this new venture: Since she was a child, Chloe Doyle has had vivid dreams about a Native American prince living in a time long forgotten. When she finds a stone that matches the one in her dreams, she accidentally unlocks immense powers she cant control. Fueled by memories of someone elses past, she sets off on a wild quest for the stones birthplace, hoping to find answers to her foreboding dreams. But she ends up finding much more than that, in the form of a man who will test every ounce of her patience. On the outside, Mason Green seems like a hard-hearted, no-nonsense type of guy, with too busy a life for romance. Very few people know the real reason for his self-imposed seclusion. Its safer that way. But when Miss Chloe Doyle barges in, hes forced to get out of hiding and face the ghosts of his past.

This is Book 1 in this new direction for Liz and marks a very smooth transition into a new genre. The writing remains high quality and the ideas are fresh and offer a sense of historic spirit life of Native Americans. A wise decision for an author highly regarded for her skill at writing paranormal works. Watch her grow into a new dimension. Grady Harp, July 16

reviewText:
Blood and Shadows is the fourth book in the Hand of Kali series by TG Ayer.

  Since many people complain about not knowing about cliffhangers, Book 4 does finish, although it does lead into the final book of the series Spirit and Soul.

  For those of you who found this review before the one for Book 3, Time and Fate  the spelling, grammar and punctuation errors are, in comparison to the first two books, next to none. There's one here and there and in either Book 3 or 4, Nik is Nick.

  Not only do with have problems with the otherworldly, but now Maya is channeling people who are dying. The evil doesn't come just from the Godly realm, but close within  and the human variety.

  If you made it this far you must like something about the series. Me I've been enjoying the storyline, the characters are like old friends by now. It's been interesting learning about a different culture I'll be sorry to see the series end with Spirit and Soul because there's much more that can be done with the storyline and characters.

  Other than a few smooches between Maya and Nik, there's really no love scenes, so this book I'd rate about PG-13.

Pan:
While I really enjoyed this series, to me Pan was less of a book, and more of an opening? Like a prequel. Not that it's a bad thing, but it's hard for me to review Pan without mentioning the other books just because it was so short. I do love the writing style though, and so far this is one of my favorite Neverland retellings!  It's easy to follow, and stays true to the original enough to know it's a retelling, but also is different enough to still be an exciting read!

Hook:
Hook was my favorite of the four! I loved seeing how a young man stuck in a print shop becomes the infamous Captain Hook! Again the writing is beautiful, and the story is exciting! See how Archie ends up serving on Blackbeard's ship Queen Anne's Revenge, and that's only the start of his adventures!

Nerida:
I can't get enough of K.R. Thompson's writing! Once again she is able to beautifully combine original characters along with those well known characters of Peter Pan into an exciting, and surprising adventure! See how the beautiful Queen of the Sea faces challenges, and a new Darkness that threatens all that is known and loved in Neverland!

Jack:
This beautiful and stunning conclusion to the Untold Stories of Neverland brings readers one last time on a quick and thrilling adventure! Old and new unite in this quick read as our time in Neverland draws to a close. See what happens to beloved characters in this fun read as we follow Jack and Lori as the pirates search for a way home, and discover a darker side of Neverland. Will they return home, and what will become of Neverland? Find out is this final chapter of the Untold Stories of Neverland!
summary: Beautifully Written and Seemlessly Weaving Old and New!

reviewText: I love when people retell fairytales and put their own spin on them! This box set is amazing and should be read by anyone who is still a kid at heart and doesn't want to grow up! This series is whimsical and will be a great read anytime! It was very engrossing and hard to put down! I just kept reading, devouring this series because I wanted more at the end of each story!

reviewText: If you thought you knew everything their was to know about Neverland, Peter Pan, Captain Hook, Tinkerbell and the Lost Boys you really need to pick up this series.  This author combined the original concept and added their own twist to create a story so captivating that you will not be able to put it down.  Have you ever wondered how it all started?  Why do Hook and Pan hate each other so much?  Who are the lost boys really and how did they come to Neverland and why?  Is Tinkerbell the only faerie or are there more?  The mermaids,  Tic Toc and the Indians what was their real purpose.  Have I caught your attention yet?  Good.  This is an amazing adventure and you are going to want to climb on board .  Remember steer for the third star on the right and straight on to morning. So get your happy thoughts ready and fly to the nearest book store to start on this magical journey.
summary: Think you know Peter Pan?  Think again

reviewText:
Pan:
Peter is a guardian who misses being a boy.  When Tink gives him the opportunity to become a boy again, Peter is excited.  Tink takes Peter to Neverland but Peter still isn't happy because he wants other kids to play with.  Tink takes him back to our world where she sees the person they're supposed to bring.  This man will be the savior of Neverland. Of course Peter doesn't want adults in Neverland and sets off to find some which our known as the lost boys.  Will Peter ever be happy?  And who is this savior that Tink wants to bring back.  Find out in the amazing short story of Pan!

Hook:
Loved this book! It's really true when they say all villains become villains somehow. I loved how this story was the beginning of how Captain Hook came about. Archie Jameson is truly a decent guy that happened to take cover in the wrong tavern. With that his life was changed forever. Though when he became captain, he was still a decent guy. He earned the respect of his crew and fell in love with an Indian. I like how this author makes Peter Pan out to be the villain. I don't know if any of you watch the show Once Upon A Time, but there version of Neverland, Peter Pan also wasn't such a good guy and Hook (known as Killian on the show) is a very likable character. This book really had be on Captain Jameson's side the entire time. Peter was not a nice boy. I can't wait to read book two in this series. This is a must read! And don't worry, Captain Hook makes his appearance before the end of the book!

Nerida:
After the loss of Nerida's sister, her father is all for Thespa, the queen of the water sprites, offer to go to a land where there are no humans.  Thespa needs her own lost ones to believe in the water sprites so that their magic stays alive just like Pan did to help Tink with his lost boys.  Even with Thespa's warning to the mermaids and mermen to not go to the land, Nerida finds herself curious.  She learns what happens when she's out of the water, discovers the lost boys as well as the pirates.  But as time goes on, you learn who the sea witch is and how she became what she now is.  Will this move from our world to Neverland be a smart one?  Find out when reading this amazing book of the Untold Stories of Neverland.

Jack:
When Jack was a boy, Peter Pan stole him from his home while Jack was still living.  Tink had told Peter not to do it but he of course didn't listen.  Over time, Jack decided he wanted to be one of the pirates.  He spent his time trying to help his crew to remember about their lives from before Neverland.  After all, the longer you spent their the more you forgot.  Jack was able to convince Hook that they needed to sale out to see every so often, but in doing so, caused differences with each crew.  Jack had begun to age.  While a pirate, Jack falls in love with mermaid Lorelei.  Will Jack continue his quest in wanting to go home when he discovers more information about his families history or will he decide he wants to stay now that he's found love?  Loved this book!

I just love this series, KR Thompson brings fantasy to life with these Untold Stories of Neverland.

Love, magic and Happy Thoughts fill the pages and capture your heart..

The authors attention to details, and vivid descriptions that make for one heck of a series. A fantasy adventure, that really had me Hooked, (Yes I said it) Neverland will never look the same again.

reviewText:
I love a universe compilation, where you get to see different authors' takes on the same "environment".  This compilation doesn't disappoint.  All of the stories focused on Feyland, yet none were the same flavor as Anthea Sharp's work.

reviewText: I loved the blending of computer games with fantasy worlds. It is worthwhile reading. Buy this book and discover all the Future Chronicles anthologies. They are all great

I have to say when I saw this was not written by Anthea Sharp I was not going to read it. Then I read the introduction that explained this  was done with her full consent and is a fun thing the authors do. So I thought OK let's do this. Well I'm so had I did! What fun I had reading the different takes the authors have explored Ms. Sharps Feyland! The characters that they decided to delve deeper into. And I love the references to Jennet, Tam, and Sparks! I couldn't wait to see what wonderful idea each new author came up with! It really was a joy to read! Thank you to all the authors!!!

Overall, a fine group of uniquely different stories, all well enough written to keep me interested from start to finish.  I never found myself skipping any of the tales once reading began, although I was irritated when a few ended just as my interest peaked, leaving me feeling they were nothing more than well crafted trailers -- commercials of a sort -- for longer tales or full novels.  Even these usually were interesting enough to keep me from feeling ripped off, but I still found them a mildly unpleasant, unexpected, and unwanted surprise I will do my best to avoid in future reads.  Luckily, they were a small percentage of the total.

I read another author in between reading this series, but finally picked these books up again and finished them.  If you can hang on past chapter 8 or 9 (in each book), then the story gets really good.  The books are well written, I just had to adjust to the pace and writing style of this author.  I got tired of the extreme descriptions of parlors and clothing.  There was some repetition, but I'm sure some parts were retold in case you hadn't read the previous book -- that's OK and makes each book standalone... but I was reading the series so I didn't need repetition.  I liked all the characters except Victoria the heroine.  She made bad choices that affected the men around her.  Another reviewer wrote: "A complex tale. I liked the men but not Victoria. She really is a spoilt brat. All the men in her life suffer from her poor choices and inabilities to accept the truth about herself, her desires and her powers. Really annoying.".  I agree with that.  When I finally got to chapter 8 of the 3rd book, I was really into the story and really enjoyed it; however, not enough to buy the next book(s).

TARZAN AND JANE DO COMMUNICATE THROUGH THEIR DESIRE AND PASSION. JANE PLACES HER TRUST IN TARZAN TO PROTECT HER.  WILL TARZAN BE ABLE TO PROTECT JANE FROM THE PIRATES THAT SHIPWRECKED HER?

THIS IS THE FIRST TIME I READ ANYTHING BY SHERI FREDRICKS AND I AM GLAD I DID.  I KNEW I HAD TO READ THIS BOOK AS SOON AS I SAW THE COVER.  LORD OF THE JUNGLE WAS A FAST READ FOR ME AND IT WAS OVER BEFORE I WANTED IT TO BE.  I LOVE HOW THE AUTHOR DOES A RETELLING OF THE STORY.  HAVING JANE BEING SHIPWRECKED AS A RESULT OF PIRATES.  IT DEFINITELY WORKED FOR ME.  I WAS DRAWN INTO THE STORY FROM THE VERY FIRST PAGE UNTIL THE END. I ENJOYED THE INTENSE CHEMISTRY AND PASSION BETWEEN TARZAN AND JANE.  THE SEX SCENES DEFINITELY MADE THE PAGES SIZZLE IN THIS BOOK.  THEIR RELATIONSHIP CONTINUED TO DEVELOP AS THE BOOK WENT ALONG.  JANE WAS DEVELOPING FEELINGS FOR TARZAN AND TARZAN WAS SO VERY PROTECTIVE OF HER AND WOULD DO ANYTHING FOR HER.  THE AUTHOR LEFT YOU WITH A CLIFFHANGER.  I AM NOT A BIG FAN OF CLIFFHANGERS SO I AM HOPING THE NEXT BOOK COMES OUT SOON.  I CAN'T WAIT TO READ THE NEXT BOOK IN THE SERIES TO SEE WHAT HAPPENS NEXT.

I WILL HAVE TO CHECK OUT MORE OF SHERI FREDRICKS BOOKS. I  ABSOLUTELY LOVE HER WRITING AND HER CHARACTERS AND CAN'T WAIT TO SEE WHAT ELSE SHE HAS WRITTEN.  SHE HAS BECOME ANOTHER ONE OF MY FAVORITE AUTHORS.
summary: THIS IS THE FIRST TIME I READ ANYTHING BY SHERI FREDRICKS AND I AM GLAD I DID

reviewText: This is the first of Sheri's books I've read and I'm glad to have gotten in on the beginning of this series. reviewText: My daughters and I enjoyed this book.  It is fun and interactive with the readers.  My girls were impressed with the illustrations.  It is a fun story and could even be a great idea for a series with more fun adventures of the pirate cats.  I received this book in a giveaway and will cherish the books for years to come!

Three sibling cats  two brothers and a sister  are abandoned in an alley. They knew that as long as they stayed together everything would be okay. While Charlie, Sam and Grace went hunting for food, they met a dog who teaches and shows the trio all sorts of fascinating things. Together, they enjoy several exciting adventures.

This was a unique spin on an animal adventure. I enjoyed the way the author had the characters working together toward a common goal. This is a wonderful way to model positive behavior and teamwork for children.

The illustrations are cute and reminded me a bit of video game graphics. I felt this made it easy for children to relate to them. The character dialogue was appropriate for the recommended age level. There was just the right amount of action and adventure. The ending contains a riddle for children to solve. Recommended!

Cute picture book for students in the primary grades. I like the author's layout using speech bubbles for the text and animation type illustrations for the animal characters. Dorey introduces his readers to three abandoned cat siblings, Grace, Sam and Charlie. Left to fend for themselves they observe a human watching a TV show about pirates. The siblings are frightened by a dog, who turns out to be a friend. He leads them to a storage locker that will provide them with the props they need to create their own pirate adventure.

This forty two page book has visual and story-line appeal for early readers. My only criticism of the book is that it does not provide a conclusion, but rather invites the reader to create their own story. While I certainly do not object to an interactive story, some readers may be disappointed that there is no definite denouement to the plot. That is my reason for not giving the book a five star rating.

I love the three kittens, Charlie, Grace, and Sam. After all, they want to be Pirates! Some of my favorite things include kitties, dogs, and pirates, so I thoroughly enjoyed this book. The cats start off on an adventure and end up with Dawg... a dog! ! The illustrations are great and the story is fun. Kids will enjoy the story and the animals. Pirates and treasures and lots of fun!

My son has read (and fallen in love) with several of this author's previous titles - especially the Monster and Dragon books.  I gave this one a quick read to see if it would be something he'd be interested in.  I can tell you, he'll be reading it this evening :)  I think this is the best book that Mr. Dorey has put out yet!  The images are terrific, and the story is great.  I think my favorite thing about the book is the open ending.  Children are asked to recall information from earlier in the story (which I think is fantastic) AND they are invited to use their imaginations to think of what happens to the kittens next.  I love finding fun ways to foster creative thinking in my kids and this book will do just that!  I really hope that there are plans in the works to turn this book into a series!!

reviewText:
I really enjoyed this story.  It hit a nerve for me, and I dove in head first. I now need to find the stories that started it all, and then read them together. Thank you for the opportunity to read this! Definitely a favorite!

*I was given a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review. Thank You

Never Say Never is the second book in the Nostradamus Prophecies by Lisa Hughey. While this book picks up right after the ending of the first in the series the main characters in this installment are different in than the first. Never Say Never focuses on Kelvin Jackson, another member of the secret government team we learned of in the first book and also Eva Pacheco the daughter of a leader of a cartel.

While on a remote viewing assignment Kel sees Eva and believes that she is being held hostage and in danger. Insisting that he is the one that goes undercover on the assignment Kel gets in with the cartel but finds out who Eva really is, not only the daughter of the man Kel is assigned to take down but also a witch with the power to read thoughts. Kel still finds himself strangely drawn to Eva which puts himself and his assignment in danger.

This series is a mixture of a paranormal romance and a fast paced thrill ride. The characters have different abilities than the ones in the first book in the series but overall the story remains much the same with the secret team members needing to solve the case they are working on.

I think this book was a bit more on the erotic side than the first in the story. Kel and Eva have a mental connection in the story and it seemed the fact they were reading each others attractions added to the steamier side of their relationship. But even with seeming to be more towards the relationship side this time there was still plenty of action in the story.

Overall, this is turning into a pretty good series so far, fast paced and intense with a mix of abilities to the characters that is fun learning about.

I received a copy from the publisher via NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

LOVED this book! This is book two in The Nostradamus Prophecies and it does not disappoint. The author is a master at crafting romantic suspence/thrillers and this book proves it. Add in a bit of paranormal and you have a compelling read. Kel is a remote viewer who uses his skills as part of a secret government team. While on a view, he sees Eva, the daughter of a Mexican crime lord, being attacked and he is compelled to go to her.

Once he infiltrates the Mexican compound, his life is in jeopardy and he doesn't know who can be trusted. He can't understand how Eva can be helping her father as he tries to weed through the lies to figure out what is really going on.

This book kept me on the edge of my seat and turning pages just as quickly as possible. While it is part of a series, it is a stand alone novel. However, it is so good that you really owe to you yourself to read them all. The author is on my must read authors' list. This is a must read for fans of the genre.
Oh I amso glad I got this set. It was so good I did not want to put it down. I laughed, teared up, worried, could not stop reading

reviewText:
Four books in a series that include a lot of different paranormals and lots of action, all in one set! What more can a reader ask for? This series is very interesting to read. reviewText: If you enjoy paranormal stories this box set may just be what you are looking for. You will find four engaging stories full of so many different paranormal creatures. Each one gives us well developed characters and worlds. This collection of stories starts with Augustus and Layla. Layla has one heck of an adventure when Augustus enters her life. The vampire opens her eyes to a whole different world that she did not even know existed. Soon Layla's world changes and she gets to enjoy the many new friends she makes. Next we get to see the angel Gabriel and Nevaeh's story. Nevaeh finds some things about herself as their relationship begins to take shape. Jazz and Rock come next. Jazz learns the truth about the man she knows as Rock. Last we get to watch Walker and Grace take their adventure.  Each of these stories revolve around one couple but we get to see and meet many of the other paranormal characters in this world. I enjoyed all the interaction between the characters. The author does a nice job of mixing action alongside the romance making this a well rounded read.

I enjoyed this box set.  And Im waiting for the rest of the books. In on my knees, we get an introduction to the 7. Which includesVampires,Archangels, Skinwalkers, Wizards, Daemons, Fae, and Changelings. This collection tells of 3 of the 7 who find love with women who complement their powers, while the women find the powers they have enhanced. They tell of the immense struggle between light and dark, including a threat from an off-world source.  These books also show that everyone has an agenda, whether light or dark.

wow, this 4 part book series was so good I was glued to every page in all 4 stories!
Book 1 On my knees is the store of a writer who makes it big by telling a story of vampires that is sexy and captivating only to find out that on her book tour she has indeed captured the eye of an actual vampire and not just any old Vamp, but one of the members of the Seven! Augustus can't keep his thoughts or eyes off her and in the midst of their courtship secrets unfold of deception by his own mom, say what!

Book 2 Ruffle my feathers, continues the unfolding secrets when the angel Gabriel must step up to the plate and surrenders his playboy role for one girl man role while helping her bring peace back to the realm they left. omg and more drama unfolds.... dark vs. light, evil vs. good.... wow things are getting real now!

Book 3 A taste of Jazz, holy cow we got a woman who saves a powerful shifter! now this is what we want to see....Jazz bounty hunter and bodyguard is hired by a powerful god to protect a shifter in hiding who is a genius.... but he is hiding and she has to find him. Thinking she is a human with a 6th sense she tracks him down but the some serious secrets unfold one of which she isn't human (WHAT). Well Connor gets kidnapped and it is up to Jazz to save the day in her colorful way....nothing like a female hero!

Book 4, Kissed by Fire....now you pause and say what am I reading here...your like I don't know who to trust, what to think, I am overwhelmed....wait this is supposed to be just a book and I am on the edge of my seat yelling at he characters.....dag this was good.  Ok so Grace thinks she is just a human with no luck but bad luck and Walker has had a horrible sad past, someone how they both meet a goddess who gives them dragon tattoos but the tattoos turn them into dragons...walker is using his gift to save people in fires for the memory of the best friend he lost. So these two meet and omg, things just get out of hand! More deceit, more secrets, and now you don't even know who the good guys are....wow this book just had me in circles. I was on the edge but then Ciana just wraps it all up by the end of book 4
now I so recommend this book!
